post.content:
I guess based on your working background, you may be able to get a job if you can achieve an immigrant VISA from Korea. I thought to apply and get an immigrant VISA in Korea seemed to be easy for people who have computer and/or network working experience.

Only concern would be English. I would say, the best way to overcome the language problem seems to be practicing the language skills (e.g. speaking, reading and writing) at work and studying the language at home and/or schoold while working. English seems to be very important to find a job and work. I do not believe that English is mandatory to get a computer or nework job in North America (Canada or US). Therefore, I believe it seems to be possible to find a job if you do think and play in a positive manner.

Therefore, I'd like to say,  1) you may try to work 2) after achieving an immigrant VISA from Korea if you are THE PERSON 3) who does think and play in a POSITIVE manner and 4) who does NOT GIVE UP easily and quickly.  

Good luck:-)

>먼저 죄송하다는 말씀 드리고 싶네요..
